result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun A Ciokiewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact directly or indirectly with: Rebecca W. without prior written consent of the agent and the victim.    No contact with:  K.C. without written consent of the agent.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
